definition: abbr. for Beijing/surname Jing/Jing ethnic minority
capital city of a country/big/algebraic term for a large number (old)/artificial mound (old)

sentences.english: He can't sing a song well, let alone Beijing Opera.
sentences.chinese: 他连一首歌曲都唱不好，更不用说唱京戏了。

sentences.english: During the Festival of Arts, I went to see a Beijing opera put up by a Shanghai troupe.
sentences.chinese: 艺术节的时候，我看了一出由上海某剧团演的京戏。

sentences.english: But now even the King of Chu is on his knees begging for mercy, can Peking opera survive this indignity?
sentences.chinese: 连楚霸王都跪下来求饶了，京戏能不亡吗？

sentences.english: Beijing Opera () () () listening to . It is the pride of China.
sentences.chinese: 京戏很值得听，它是神州的骄傲。

sentences.english: Do you know something about chinese opera?

definition: dan, female roles in Chinese opera (traditionally played by specialized male actors)
Kunqu opera, influential musical theater originating in Kunshan, Jiangsu province in Yuan times
model theater (operas and ballets produced during the Cultural Revolution)
Ma Lianliang (1901-1966), Beijing opera star, one of the Four great beards 四大鬚生|四大须生
erhua variant of 名角[ming2 jue2]
local Chinese opera, such as Shaoxing opera 越劇|越剧[Yue4 ju4], Sichuan opera 川劇|川剧[Chuan1 ju4], Henan opera 豫劇|豫剧[Yu4 ju4] etc
Tan Fuying (1906-1977), Beijing opera star, one of the Four great beards 四大鬚生|四大须生
jinghu, a smaller, higher-pitched erhu 二胡 (two-stringed fiddle) used to accompany Chinese opera/also called 京二胡
